channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Harris Campaign Begins
item.description: The Democratic Party’s biggest weaknesses — and how they offer Kamala Harris an opportunity.

item.title: Noriko Ohara, Voice Actress Known for Nobita in ‘Doraemon,’ Dies at 88
item.description: Her voice became widely recognized in Japan after she starred in animated shows watched by nearly every child in the country and beyond.

item.title: South Korea arrests the founder of one of its biggest internet companies over a K-pop stock rigging scandal
item.description: South Korean authorities have arrested Kakao Corp. founder Brian Kim over allegations of market manipulation.

item.title: Harris Closes In on Nomination, and Secret Service Chief Berated
item.description: Plus, A.I. chatbots are flunking math.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli Forces Strike in Humanitarian Zone; Scores Reported Killed
item.description: The Israeli military warned Gazans to leave part of what it had previously designated as a relatively safe area in Khan Younis, saying Hamas had launched rockets from there.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway cuts its stake in EV giant BYD to under 5%, dropping below Hong Kong’s disclosure threshold
item.description: The days of calling BYD a “Buffett-backed” company may soon be coming to a close.

item.title: Trump’s Race Against Harris May Bring Out His Harshest Instincts
item.description: After years planning to face President Biden, Donald J. Trump and his team will be campaigning against Kamala Harris. He has attacked female rivals and critics in brutal and personal terms.

item.title: After Harris Declines, Senator Will Preside at Netanyahu’s Speech to Congress
item.description: An aide to Vice President Kamala Harris said she had a scheduling conflict but would meet with the Israeli prime minister this week.

item.title: Finance guru Dave Ramsey believes spousal interviews should be part of the hiring process: ‘Discover if your candidate is married to crazy’
item.description: "As the spouse hears about your culture and the job role, they’re usually eager to share whether they think the position fits."

item.title: Are Democrats Right to Unite Around Kamala Harris?
item.description: The Democratic Party has a chance to organize for victory.

item.title: Netanyahu Seeks Support in U.S. Visit, but Will Find a Nation Distracted
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is to meet President Biden and address Congress this week, swapping one political maelstrom at home for another in Washington.

item.title: The global M&A market’s big-deal bravado is losing steam as rates stay high in 2024
item.description: The largest sector for M&A globally was technology, with deal volume up 37% year on year, of which North America made up some 66% of the total.

item.title: Trump Tries to Flip the Script on Democracy After Biden’s Withdrawal
item.description: Donald J. Trump and his allies said President Biden’s primary voters were disenfranchised. Democrats noted Mr. Trump had once tried to toss out millions of ballots.

item.title: Founder of Kakao, South Korean Tech Giant, Arrested Over K-Pop Deal
item.description: Kim Beom-su, the billionaire behind Kakao, was taken into custody on allegations of stock manipulation during a bidding war over a K-pop agency.

item.title: European cities are trying to shun young ‘drunk’ tourists in favor of big spenders, but there are concerns the move could be classist
item.description: “We don’t want the tourists who come to do what they can’t do in their own countries,” says Mateu Hernández, director-general of Turisme de Barcelona.
